title: Metacognitive-Based Mathematical Project Design: Practical Strategies for Elementary School Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical concepts and general educational principles comprehension
context.additional_context: Flexible modular design for time-constrained working learners. Case-centered design applicable to real classrooms

learning_goals: Learners can design and implement mathematical project-based learning processes by utilizing metacognitive strategies (planning-monitoring-evaluation).
Learners can develop and apply at least three metacognitive questioning frameworks that promote student-led problem-solving.
Learners can quantitatively and qualitatively assess the effectiveness of improving elementary students' mathematical thinking skills through project outcomes.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
